subject: Chemistry
question_text: Given below are two statements : Statement (I) : Corrosion is an electrochemical phenomenon in which pure metal acts as an anode and impure metal as a cathode. Statement (II) : The rate of corrosion is more in alkaline options given below : 2025 (22 Jan Shift 2) JEE Main 2025 January JEE Main Previous Year Paper MathonGo x × 10 −5 T x μ 0 = 4π × 10 −7 SI 1.25 g/mL [Co(NH 3 ) 4 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2+ < [Co(en) 3 ] 3+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 3+ [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 3+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 4 ] 2+ < [Co(en) 3 ] 3+ [Co(en) 3 ] 3+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 3+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 4 ] 2+ [Co(NH 3 ) 4 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 3+ < [Co(en) 3 ] 3+
question_latex: Given below are two statements : Statement (I) : Corrosion is an electrochemical phenomenon in which pure metal acts as an anode and impure metal as a cathode. Statement (II) : The rate of corrosion is more in alkaline options given below : 2025 (22 Jan Shift 2) JEE Main 2025 January JEE Main Previous Year Paper MathonGo x × 10 −5 T x μ 0 = 4π × 10 −7 SI 1.25 $\frac{g}{mL}$ [Co(NH 3 ) 4 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2+ < [Co(en) 3 ] 3+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 3+ [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 3+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 4 ] 2+ < [Co(en) 3 ] 3+ [Co(en) 3 ] 3+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 3+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 4 ] 2+ [Co(NH 3 ) 4 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 2+ < [Co(NH 3 ) 6 ] 3+ < [Co(en) 3 ] 3+

options.text: (1) Both Statement I and Statement II are true
(2) Statement I is false but Statement II is true
(3) Statement I is true but Statement II is false
(4) Both Statement I and Statement II are false
